post.description:
Trigger a sync for a specific integration.

> Please note that it is **not** necessary nor recommended to call this endpoint periodically on your side. Kombo already performs period syncs for you and you should only trigger syncs yourself in special cases (like when a user clicks on a "Sync" button in your app).

schema.description: POST /force-sync request body

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

url.description: Full URL of the request that we automatically assemble for you based on the specified `api`, the specified `path`, and the integration's auth credentials. You can use this to debug path-related issues (e.g., the API returning 404 errors).

status.description: Status code returned from the remote system.

post.description:
At Kombo we put a lot of work into making sure that our unified API covers all our customers' use cases and that they never have to think about integration-specific logic again. There are cases, however, where our customers want to build features that are very integration-specfic. That's where this endpoint comes in.

Pass in details about the request you want to make to the integration's API and we'll forward it for you. We'll also take care of setting the right base URL and authenticating your requests.

To get started, please pick the relevant API (some tools provide multiple to due different base URLs or authentication schemes) from the table below and pass in the `{tool}/{api}` identifier as part of the path.

|Integration|`{tool}/{api}`|Description|
|---|---|---|
|Personio|`personio/personnel`|Personio's [Personnel Data API](https://developer.personio.de/reference/get_company-employees). We automatically authenticate all requests using the client ID and secret and use `https://api.personio.de/v1` as the base URL.|
|Personio|`personio/recruiting`|Personio's [Recruiting API](https://developer.personio.de/reference/get_company-employees). We automatically authenticate all requests using the Recruiting access token and use `https://api.personio.de/v1/recruiting` as the base URL.|
|Personio|`personio/jobboard`|API endpoints exposed on Personio's public job board pages ([currently just the XML feed](https://developer.personio.de/reference/get_xml)). We automatically use the right `https://{company}.jobs.personio.de` base URL.|
|Recruitee|`recruitee/default`|The [Recruitee API](https://api.recruitee.com/docs/index.html). We automatically authenticate all requests and use `https://api.recruitee.com` as the base URL.|

> Please note that the pass-through API endpoints are only meant for edge cases. That's why we only expose them for new integrations after understanding a concrete customer use case. If you have such a use case in mind, please reach out to Kombo.

schema.description: POST /passthrough/:tool/:api parameter
POST /passthrough/:tool/:api parameter
POST /passthrough/:tool/:api request body

delete.description: Delete the specified integration. **‚ö†Ô∏è This can not be undone!**

schema.description: DELETE /integrations/:integration_id parameter
DELETE /integrations/:integration_id request body

id.description: The ID of the connected tool in Kombo (e.g. `factorial`).

logo_url.description: URL to an SVG logo of the connected tool. The logo usually contains the tool name.

icon_url.description: URL to a square SVG icon of the connected tool.

origin_id.description: The ID you have passed initially to the connection flow to create this integration.

schema.description: GET /integrations/:integration_id parameter

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

gender.description: One of 4 standardized values (`MALE`, `FEMALE`, `NON_BINARY`, or `NOT_SPECIFIED`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

ethnicity.description: One of 8 standardized values (`WHITE`, `ASIAN`, `HISPANIC_LATINO`, `HAWAIIAN`, `NATIVE_AMERICAN`, `BLACK_AFRICAN_AMERICAN`, `MULTIPLE_ETHNICITIES`, or `DECLINE_TO_SPECIFY`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

marital_status.description: One of 7 standardized values (`SINGLE`, `MARRIED`, `DOMESTIC_PARTNERSHIP`, `WIDOWED`, `DIVORCED`, `SEPARATED`, or `NOT_MARRIED`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

employment_status.description: One of 4 standardized values (`ACTIVE`, `PENDING`, `INACTIVE`, or `LEAVE`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

employment_type.description: One of 6 standardized values (`FULL_TIME`, `PART_TIME`, `CONTRACT`, `INTERNSHIP`, `FREELANCE`, or `WORKING_STUDENT`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

avatar.description: URL to the employee's avatar. This is either the raw URL from the HR system (in cases where it can be requested without short-lived authentication) _or_ a URL to a temporarily cached version of the file hosted by Kombo. Kombo will delete the cached file after its deletion in the source system.

job_title.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** We now provide the `job_title` directly on the employee model.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

pay_period.description: One of 10 standardized values (`HOUR`, `DAY`, `WEEK`, `TWO_WEEKS`, `HALF_MONTH`, `MONTH`, `TWO_MONTHS`, `QUARTER`, `HALF_YEAR`, or `YEAR`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

pay_frequency.description: One of 8 standardized values (`WEEKLY`, `BIWEEKLY`, `MONTHLY`, `SEMIMONTHLY`, `QUARTERLY`, `SEMIANNUALLY`, `ANNUALLY`, or `PRO_RATA`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

teams.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** Please use the `groups` field. It includes the same data and the naming is less confusing.

503.description: Returned when no sync has finished successfully yet

example.message: The first sync of this integration didn't finish yet! You can keep polling this until you get a successful response or react to our webhooks.

error.message: The first sync of this integration didn't finish yet! You can keep polling this until you get a successful response or react to our webhooks.

get.description:
Retrieve all employees.

_Not interested in most fields? You can use our [our Scopes feature](https://docs.kombo.dev/docs/scopes) to customize what data points will synced._

```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "next": "eyJwYWdlIjoxMiwibm90ZSI6InRoaXMgaXMganVzdCBhbiBleGFtcGxlIGFuZCBub3QgcmVwcmVzZW50YXRpdmUgZm9yIGEgcmVhbCBjdXJzb3IhIn0=",
    "results": [
      {
        "id": "26vafvWSRmbhNcxJYqjCzuJg",
        "remote_id": "32",
        "employee_number": "3243422",
        "first_name": "John",
        "last_name": "Doe",
        "display_full_name": "John Doe",
        "job_title": "Integrations Team Lead",
        "work_email": "john.doe@acme.com",
```

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

schema.description: The cursor retrieved from the previous request when paginating
The number of results to return per page
Filter the entries based on the modification date. If you want to track entry deletion, also set the `include_deleted=true` query parameter, because otherwise, deleted entries will be hidden.
By default, deleted entries are not returned. Use the `include_deleted` query param to include deleted entries too.
Filter by a comma-separated list of employee IDs such as `222k7eCGyUdgt2JWZDNnkDs3,B5DVmypWENfU6eMe6gYDyJG3`.
Filter by the `employment_status` field.

post.description:
Create a new employee.

Requires the permission "Create and manage employees".


```json
{
  "first_name": "John",
  "last_name": "Doe",
  "work_email": "john.doe@acme.com",
  "ssn": "555-32-6395",
  "gender": "MALE",
  "marital_status": "MARRIED",
  "job_title": "Integrations Team Lead",
  "home_address": {
    "city": "Berlin",
    "country": "Germany",
    "state": "Berlin",
    "street_1": "Sonnenallee 63",
    "zip_code": "12045"
  },
  "date_of_birth": "1986-01-01",
  "start_date": "2020-04-07",
  "termination_date": "2022-05-20",
  "tax_id": "12 345 678 901"
}
```

schema.description: POST /hris/employees request body

ssn.description: Social security number of the employee.

job_title.description: Title of the position this person is working in.

country.description: Some tools allow free text but most require `ISO 3166-1 alpha-2` codes. For systems that have other formats, Kombo transforms the ISO Codes to the appropriate value.

home_address.description: Nested object of the home address.

start_date.description: Start date of the employee. Also considered to the hire date.

termination_date.description: Date on which the employment ends.

tax_id.description: Tax ID of the employee. Most contries have different formats of that. In Germany, this is the `Steuer ID` and in the US it's the `TIN`.

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

gender.description: One of 4 standardized values (`MALE`, `FEMALE`, `NON_BINARY`, or `NOT_SPECIFIED`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

ethnicity.description: One of 8 standardized values (`WHITE`, `ASIAN`, `HISPANIC_LATINO`, `HAWAIIAN`, `NATIVE_AMERICAN`, `BLACK_AFRICAN_AMERICAN`, `MULTIPLE_ETHNICITIES`, or `DECLINE_TO_SPECIFY`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

marital_status.description: One of 7 standardized values (`SINGLE`, `MARRIED`, `DOMESTIC_PARTNERSHIP`, `WIDOWED`, `DIVORCED`, `SEPARATED`, or `NOT_MARRIED`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

employment_status.description: One of 4 standardized values (`ACTIVE`, `PENDING`, `INACTIVE`, or `LEAVE`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

employment_type.description: One of 6 standardized values (`FULL_TIME`, `PART_TIME`, `CONTRACT`, `INTERNSHIP`, `FREELANCE`, or `WORKING_STUDENT`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

avatar.description: URL to the employee's avatar. This is either the raw URL from the HR system (in cases where it can be requested without short-lived authentication) _or_ a URL to a temporarily cached version of the file hosted by Kombo. Kombo will delete the cached file after its deletion in the source system.

patch.description:
Update an employee.

Requires the permission "Create and manage employees".


```json
{
  "employee_id": "BkgfzSr5muN9cUTMD4wDQFn4",
  "first_name": "John",
  "last_name": "Doe",
  "work_email": "john.doe@acme.com",
  "ssn": "555-32-6395",
  "tax_id": "12 345 678 901",
  "gender": "MALE",
  "marital_status": "MARRIED",
  "date_of_birth": "1986-01-01",
  "start_date": "2020-04-07",
  "termination_date": "2022-05-20",
  "job_title": "Integrations Team Lead",
  "home_address": {
    "city": "Berlin",
    "country": "Germany",
    "state": "Berlin",
    "street_1": "Sonnenallee 63",
    "zip_code": "12045"
  }
}
```

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

schema.description: ID of the employee that should be updated. You can use their Kombo `id` or their ID in the remote system by prefixing it with `remote:` (e.g., `remote:12312`)
PATCH /hris/employees/:employee_id request body

ssn.description: Social security number of the employee.

job_title.description: Title of the position this person is working in.

country.description: Some tools allow free text but most require `ISO 3166-1 alpha-2` codes. For systems that have other formats, Kombo transforms the ISO Codes to the appropriate value.

home_address.description: Nested object of the home address.

start_date.description: Start date of the employee. Also considered to the hire date.

termination_date.description: Date on which the employment ends.

tax_id.description: Tax ID of the employee. Most contries have different formats of that. In Germany, this is the `Steuer ID` and in the US it's the `TIN`.

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

schema.description: ID of the employee that should be updated. You can use their Kombo `id` or their ID in the remote system by prefixing it with `remote:` (e.g., `remote:12312`)
PUT /hris/employees/:employee_id/compensations request body

effective_date.description: Date from which the submitted compensations should be valid. Please note that it might not be possible to set compensations for the past if the payroll was already run.

amount.description: The amount that this employee will be paid.

currency.description: The currency in which the employee gets paid. Currently, only euro is supported as integrated systems only work with Euro.

period.description: The period for which the specified amount is paid. Currently, integrated systems only support "HOUR" and "MONTH".

503.description: Returned when no sync has finished successfully yet

error.message: The first sync of this integration didn't finish yet! You can keep polling this until you get a successful response or react to our webhooks.

The number of results to return per page
Filter the entries based on the modification date. If you want to track entry deletion, also set the `include_deleted=true` query parameter, because otherwise, deleted entries will be hidden.
By default, deleted entries are not returned. Use the `include_deleted` query param to include deleted entries too.

```json
{
  "status": "success",

    "next": "eyJwYWdlIjoxMiwibm90ZSI6InRoaXMgaXMganVzdCBhbiBleGFtcGxlIGFuZCBub3QgcmVwcmVzZW50YXRpdmUgZm9yIGEgcmVhbCBjdXJzb3IhIn0=",
    "results": [
      {
        "id": "12vpXR7BeqYNWDShXRgsonnm",
        "remote_id": "859",
        "employee_id": "8Xk99QfVKYA6vfEafEUBdEPJ",
        "job_title": "Social Media Marketer",
        "pay_rate": 85000,
        "pay_period": "YEAR",
        "pay_frequency": "SEMIMONTHLY",
        "pay_currency": "EUR",
        "effective_date": "2021-01-30T00:00:00.000Z",

}
```

_If the first sync did not finish yet, a `503` status code will be returned to ensure you don't get incomplete data. This allows you to pull until the data is complete (we recommend you to depend on our webhooks though)._

get.description:
Retrieve all time off balances.

```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
```

Filter the entries based on the modification date. If you want to track entry deletion, also set the `include_deleted=true` query parameter, because otherwise, deleted entries will be hidden.

start_date.description: The date this absence starts in the `yyyy-MM-dd` format.

end_date.description: The date this absence ends in the `yyyy-MM-dd` format.

start_half_day.description: `true` if the absence starts in the middle of the day, `false` if not, and `null` if the system doesn't support half-day absences.

end_half_day.description: `true` if the absence ends in the middle of the day, `false` if not, and `null` if the system doesn't support half-day absences.

start_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** A timestamp of when this absence starts. This is deprecated because very few HR systems actually keep track of specific times for absences. Please use a combination of `start_date` and `start_half_day` instead.

end_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** A timestamp of when this absence ends. This is deprecated because very few HR systems actually keep track of specific times for absences. Please use a combination of `start_date` and `start_half_day` instead.

half_days_supported.description: Whether the integration supports half-day absences (represented through `start_half_day` and `end_half_day`) for this absence type.

get.description:
Retrieve all absences.

```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "next": "eyJwYWdlIjoxMiwibm90ZSI6InRoaXMgaXMganVzdCBhbiBleGFtcGxlIGFuZCBub3QgcmVwcmVzZW50YXRpdmUgZm9yIGEgcmVhbCBjdXJzb3IhIn0=",
    "results": [
      {
        "id": "22st2Ji8XpncEYEak8mvQgQF",
        "remote_id": "1348",
        "employee_id": "JDdUy9kiH5APaGizFrgNmQjM",
        "approver_id": "AgXEispYPP1BbToHpqnqcpxy",
        "start_date": "2022-08-04",
        "end_date": "2022-08-05",
        "start_half_day": true,
        "end_half_day": false,
        "start_time": "2022-08-04T00:00:00.000Z",
        "end_time": "2022-08-05T00:00:00.000Z",
        "amount": 2,
        "unit": "DAYS",
        "status": "APPROVED",
        "employee_note": "Visiting my family.",
        "changed_at": "2022-08-07T14:01:29.196Z",
        "remote_deleted_at": "2022-08-07T14:01:29.196Z",
        "type_id": "xzZoKssDaMZAd62kxayzzQvD",
        "type": {
          "id": "xzZoKssDaMZAd62kxayzzQvD",
          "name": "Vacation",
          "unit": "DAYS",
          "half_days_supported": true,
          "remote_id": "91",
          "changed_at": "2022-08-07T14:01:29.196Z",
          "remote_deleted_at": null
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

> ‚Äãüí° Scroll down and click on "200" to view the detailed response schema.

_If the first sync did not finish yet, a `503` status code will be returned to ensure you don't get incomplete data. This allows you to pull until the data is complete (we recommend you to depend on our webhooks though)._

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

schema.description: The cursor retrieved from the previous request when paginating
The number of results to return per page
Filter the entries based on the modification date. If you want to track entry deletion, also set the `include_deleted=true` query parameter, because otherwise, deleted entries will be hidden.
By default, deleted entries are not returned. Use the `include_deleted` query param to include deleted entries too.
Filter for all the absences that either start _or_ haven't ended yet on/after this day. If you imagine a calendar displaying absences, this defines the left-most visible day.
Filter for absences that start on or before this day (but might continue after). If you imagine a calendar displaying absences, this defines the right-most visible day.
Filter by a specific employee using their ID.
**(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** Filter for absences that either start after or start before and end after a certain time. Please use `date_from` instead.
**(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** Filter for absences that start before a certain time. Please use `date_until` instead.

start_date.description: The date this absence starts in the `yyyy-MM-dd` format.

end_date.description: The date this absence ends in the `yyyy-MM-dd` format.

start_half_day.description: `true` if the absence starts in the middle of the day, `false` if not, and `null` if the system doesn't support half-day absences.

end_half_day.description: `true` if the absence ends in the middle of the day, `false` if not, and `null` if the system doesn't support half-day absences.

start_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** A timestamp of when this absence starts. This is deprecated because very few HR systems actually keep track of specific times for absences. Please use a combination of `start_date` and `start_half_day` instead.

end_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** A timestamp of when this absence ends. This is deprecated because very few HR systems actually keep track of specific times for absences. Please use a combination of `start_date` and `start_half_day` instead.

post.description:
Create a new absence.

Requires the permission "Manage absences".


```json
{
  "employee_id": "wXJMxwDvPAjrJ4CyqdV9",
  "absence_type_id": "3YKtQ7qedsrcCady1jSyAkY1",
  "start_date": "2019-09-17",
  "end_date": "2019-09-21",
  "start_half_day": false,
  "end_half_day": false,
  "employee_note": "Visiting the aliens"
}
```

schema.description: POST /hris/absences request body

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee in Kombo or their ID in the remote system by prefixing it with `remote:` (e.g., `remote:12312`)

absence_type_id.description: The ID of the absence type in Kombo (not its `remote_id`).

start_date.description: When the absence starts. This is a plain date (i.e., `yyyy-MM-dd`), all time information is discarded.

end_date.description: When the absence ends. This is a plain date (i.e., `yyyy-MM-dd`), all time information is discarded.

start_half_day.description: `true` if the absence should start in the middle of the day.

end_half_day.description: `true` if the absence should end in the middle of the day.

employee_note.description: A note describing the reason for this absence.

start_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** When the absence starts. This has been deprecated because most HR systems ignore time information. Please use `start_date` (and `start_half_day` if necessary).

end_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** When the absence ends. This has been deprecated because most HR systems ignore time information. Please use `end_date` (and `end_half_day` if necessary).

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

start_date.description: The date this absence starts in the `yyyy-MM-dd` format.

end_date.description: The date this absence ends in the `yyyy-MM-dd` format.

start_half_day.description: `true` if the absence starts in the middle of the day, `false` if not, and `null` if the system doesn't support half-day absences.

end_half_day.description: `true` if the absence ends in the middle of the day, `false` if not, and `null` if the system doesn't support half-day absences.

start_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** A timestamp of when this absence starts. This is deprecated because very few HR systems actually keep track of specific times for absences. Please use a combination of `start_date` and `start_half_day` instead.

end_time.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** A timestamp of when this absence ends. This is deprecated because very few HR systems actually keep track of specific times for absences. Please use a combination of `start_date` and `start_half_day` instead.

delete.description:
Delete this absence.

Requires the permission "Manage absences".


```json
{
  "absence_id": "wXJMxwDvPAjrJ4CyqdV9"
}
```

POST /ats/candidates request body

email_address.description: The primary email address this application will be created with.

company.description: The company where the applicant is currently working.

title.description: The current job title of the applicant.

country.description: The uppercase two-letter ISO country (e.g., `DE`) of the applicant.

job_id.description: Kombo ID or Remote ID of the Job this candidate should apply for. If you want to use the ID of the integrated system (remote_id) you need to prefix the id with "remote:". You can use the remote ID if you do not want to sync jobs.

stage_id.description: Stage this candidate should be in. If left out, the default stage for this job will be used.

application.description: Currently, every candidate has one application. If you are interested in talent pools, please contact Kombo.

data.description: Base64-encoded file. Please note that some systems have maximum file sizes.

name.description: Name of the file you want to upload.

attachments.description: Array of the attachments you would like upload. Some tools require for example at least a CV per application.

post.description:
Adds a result link to a candidate. This can, for example, be used to link a candidate back to a test result/assessment in your application. As not all ATS tools have a "result link" feature, we sometimes repurpose other fields to expose it.

Requires the permission "Create and manage candidates and applications".


```json
{
  "label": "Assessment Result",
  "url": "https://example.com/test-results/5BtP1WC1UboS7CF3yxjKcvjG"
}
```

parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

schema.description: Kombo ID of the candidate you want to create the link for.

label.description: If we can display a display name for the link, we will use this label.

confidential.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** It makes more sense to store the visibility of a job in an enum. Therefore, we introduced the `visibility` enum on jobs.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

employment_type.description: One of 3 standardized values (`FULL_TIME`, `PART_TIME`, or `CONTRACT`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

status.description: One of 4 standardized values (`OPEN`, `CLOSED`, `DRAFT`, or `ARCHIVED`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

visibility.description:
Describes the visibility of the job:

- `PUBLIC`: visible to everyone, published on a job board
- `INTERNAL`: only visible to employees of the company itself
- `UNLISTED`: anyone can apply but only if they have the link to it
- `CONFIDENTIAL`: nobody can apply and it's only visible in the ATS to people who were invited to it

Useful if you are providing a job board and want to post public open jobs of your customers/partners.

post_url.description: The public job posting URL of the ATS itself. This can be used by external job boards to redirect applicants.

oneOf.description: If we can't find a clear mapping: The original string passed through.

salary_period.description: One of 6 standardized values (`YEAR`, `MONTH`, `TWO_WEEKS`, `WEEK`, `DAY`, or `HOUR`) **or** ‚Äî in rare cases where can't find a clear mapping ‚Äî the original string passed through.

POST /connect/create-link request body

end_user_email.description: The email of the user this link is meant for.

end_user_organization_name.description: The name of the user's organization.

end_user_origin_id.description: The id the user/organization has in your own database.

integration_category.description: Category of the integration you want your customer to create.

integration_tool.description: Pre-define a tool this integration link can be used for.

redirect_url.description: **(‚ö†Ô∏è Deprecated)** Where the user should be redirected to after the integration was created successfully. This is deprecated and should **not** be specified for [our new embedded flow](https://docs.kombo.dev/docs/embedded-flow).

post.description:
Activate an integration that was just created via Kombo Connect.

_Check out [our full guide](https://docs.kombo.dev/docs/embedded-flow) for more details about implementing the connection flow._

```json
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "tool": "personio",
    "id": "personio:CBNMt7dSNCzBdnRTx87dev4E",
    "end_user_origin_id": "36123",
    "end_user_organization_name": "Acme, Inc.",
    "end_user_email": "user@example.com"
  }
}
```

> ‚Äãüí° Scroll down and click on "200" to view the detailed response schema.

schema.description: POST /connect/activate-integration request body

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

schema.description: ID of the employee that should be updated. You can use their Kombo `id` or their ID in the remote system by prefixing it with `remote:` (e.g., `remote:12312`)
PUT /custom/datev/employees/:employee_id/prepare-payroll request body

hours.description: Number of hours this employee has worked.

lohnart.description: The "Lohnart" (payment-type) in DATEV. Make sure a Lohnart is selected that actually supports hours.

hourly_payments.description: Add entries for all the hourly calculated supplements here. For example you can write "Overtime" or "Work on Holidays" (in hours here). Unfortunately, DATEV doens't allow showing a lable for the entries.

lohnart.description: The "Lohnart" (payment-type) in DATEV. Make sure a Lohnart is selected that actually supports fixed payments (no hourly modifier).

fixed_payments.description: Add entries for all the fixed supplements here. For example you can write "Bonuses" (in Euros here). Unfortunately, DATEV doens't allow showing a lable for the entries.

type.description: Type of the executed data push.

created_at.description: Date when the push-data endpoint was called.

state.description: If we were not able to send the file to DATEV, we will set the state "FAILED". The other values are synced from DATEV for the respective import jobs.

upload_jobs.description: List of all the submitted files. This can include multiple files if data was edited for multiple months.

get.description: Returns all "DATEV Data Pushes" of the last 2 months. You can use this endpoint to give your users transparency about submitted "ASCII-Files" and their status. Each data push can contain multiple files that were submitted.

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

post.description: Uploads the currently relevant general data (employees, compensations, and time offs) to DATEV. This will create so called ASCII files that the accountant has to import in DATEV. You can call this endpoint to implement an on-demand sync to DATEV, for example if you want to offer your users a button to do that in your application.

schema.description: POST /custom/datev/push-data/general request body

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.

post.description: Uploads the currently relevant payroll data (supplements) to DATEV. This will create so called ASCII files that the accountant has to import in DATEV. After finishing the payroll preparation or after correcting payroll, you can call this.

schema.description: POST /custom/datev/push-data/payroll request body

payroll_month.description: Specify the month for which the payroll data should be sunmitted. The date must be specified as the first day of a month (e.g. 2022-12-01).

parameters.name: X-Integration-Id
parameters.description: ID of the integration you want to interact with.
